newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal may privatise 25 pct of EDP -president.
newsitem.headline: Portugal may privatise 25 pct of EDP -president.

text.p: The stake to be sold in the privatisation next month of state utility EDP-Electricidade de Portugal may be 25 percent, its president Antonio de Almeida said.
Almeida, speaking at a roadshow to promote the sale, also said that a 10 percent stake of the capital to be sold in the domestic and international direct sale could be sold in a "green shoe."
Under a "green shoe" option, additional shares may be allocated to institutional investors if demand is very heavy.
Almeida said he expected that 27.5 percent of EDP's capital of 600 billion escudos ($3.5 billion) would be sold off in the privatisation, including the green shoe.
He said that he expected 55 percent of the stake would be sold in the public offer for sale (OPV) and 45 percent in the domestic and international direct sale.
